sect2.title: Installation of Ghostscript
sect2.para: Install GPL Ghostscript by running the following commands:

note.para: The Ghostscript build system is not user-friendly. In order to use system copies of various graphics libraries, you must do it using unconventional methods.

sect2.para: GPL Ghostscript includes (old) copies of several libraries. Some of these seem to have been patched to fix known vulnerabilities, but others of these copies are less-well maintained. To ensure that any future fixes are applied throughout the whole system, it is recommended that you install the released versions of these libraries and then configure GPL Ghostscript to link to them.
If you have installed these dependencies on your system, remove the copies of expat, freetype, lcms2, libjpeg, libpng, and libtiff:

screen.userinput: rm -rf expat freetype jpeg lcms2 libpng tiff

note.para: If you have a multicore computer and try to run make with multiple jobs (eg, make -j4) then the build may fail due to race conditions in the Ghostscript build system.

screen.userinput: rm -rf jasper lcms zlib && ./configure --prefix=/usr --enable-dynamic --with-system-libtiff LIBS=-lz && make

sect2.title: Command Explanations
sect2.para: rm -rf jasper lcms zlib: The Ghostscript build system defaults to using its own version of OpenJpeg for JPEG 2000 files so we can all remove the jasper source. The default color management system is now lcms2 so the lcms source is not needed. Zlib was installed as part of LFS.
--with-system-libtiff: Remove this option if you've not installed .
LIBS=-lz: We use the LIBS variable to tell the linker (ld) to link against the system installed zlib.
install -v -m644 base/*.h...: Some packages (ImageMagick is one) need the Ghostscript interface headers in place to link to the shared library. These commands install the headers.
ln -v -s ghostscript /usr/include/ps: Some packages expect to find the interface headers in an alternate location.
ln -sfv ../ghostscript-&gs-version;/doc ...: This puts a symbolic link to the documentation where it is expected to be found.
